channel.title: How to remove Commands
channel.description:
I have a command i want to get rid of, i am using deltascape , it is combattscape source, i have a command called ::master that gives 99 in all combat skills. How would i remove this? i know i go to client.java and erase, compile and restart, but when i do that, it still lets people do ::master, i've completely erased all of the ::master commands, but it still works, how can i fix this?
future thanks

item.title: How to remove Commands
item.dc:creator: @DarienM DarienM
item.description:
@DarienM wrote:

lol.
this is so much trouble for one little thing.

Read full topic

item.title: How to remove Commands
item.dc:creator: @DarienM DarienM
item.description:
@DarienM wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:10, topic:352576”]Use this, put that in a new .bat file and name it Class Deleter.

del *.class

Try re compiling and see if that fixes it.[/quote]

you want me, to make a new .bat file? and just put that in it?

WOW, IT DELETED HALF MY FOLDERS!

Read full topic

item.title: How to remove Commands
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Use this, put that in a new .bat file and name it Class Deleter.

del *.class

Try re compiling and see if that fixes it.

Read full topic

item.title: How to remove Commands
item.dc:creator: @DarienM DarienM
item.description:
@DarienM wrote:

jmood128:

Make sure that the run.bat is finding the updated files, the compiler might be sending all the compile code to another folder look in the compiler to make sure the files go in the same folder as the run.bat

ummm idk how to read my compiler

heres the compiler

@echo off @TITLE Digital Dogs if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. :end echo Finished! pause exit

heres my run.bat

@echo off title Source 474 java -Xmx1200m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server exit

Read full topic

item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

check if there is a file called commands.java

nope, and i DID change it to 3, and it still does that.

item.title: How to remove Commands
item.dc:creator: @kickyamom50 kickyamom50
item.description:
@kickyamom50 wrote:

check your compiler code…if that doesn’t work then just set the “::master” code to permission 3 so you’re the only one who can do it…

Read full topic
